description.narrative: By 2022, child and family welfare, justice for children and birth registration laws and regulations are aligned with child protection policies and international standards.

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Inter-sectoral coordination and collaboration on violence, exploitation and abuse
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Public finance management for child protection
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

title.narrative: Ghana United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Ghana Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Child Protection)
Ghana Country Programme Document 2012-2016 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Ghana: Summative Evaluation of Ghana’s Child Protection System Strengthening at District Level
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, child and family welfare, justice for children and birth registration laws and regulations are aligned with child protection policies and international standards.

description.narrative: The data collection of the National Survey of Residential Homes for Children has been completed along with a mapping of social service in the 260 districts as well as a social welfare workforce assessment have been completed. Draft amendments of the Children's Act, the Juvenile Justice Act, the Criminal and Other Offences Act, Electronic Transaction Act were completed and submitted to the government. Majority of the 260 municipalities and districts have included child protection related protocols in their medium-term development plans 2018-2021. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect
Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex

baseline.value: Data gallery containing children data was published in 2016.

target.value: 2022:State of Ghanaian Child Report is issues every two years.

title.narrative: Key articles of the UN CRC and CEDAW and their optional protocols dealing with violence, exploitation and abuse have been domesticated into national legislation

baseline.value: Juvenile Justice Act, Criminal Procedures Act, Childrens

target.value: 2022:All mentioned laws and amended and regulations approved

actual.value: 2020:Criminal Offenses, Juvenile Justice Act and Children's act are still awaiting submission to Cabinet for approval
